definitions.definition: The same height at all places ; parallel to a flat ground .
examples: This table isn't quite level ; see how this marble rolls off it?

definitions.definition: At the same height as some reference ; constructed as level with .
examples: We tried to hang the pictures so that the bottom of the frames were level with the dark line in the wallpaper.
His pulse has been level for 12 hours.
His voice has been unchanged. It has been level for 12 hours.
He kept a level head under stress.

definitions.definition: In the same position or rank .
Well balanced ; even ; just ; steady ; impartial .
examples: a level head; a level understanding

definitions.definition: Of even tone ; without rising or falling inflection; monotonic .

examples: The earth's oceans remain level in relation to the pull of gravity.

main_definition: The same height at all places ; parallel to a flat ground .
secondary_definitions: At the same height as some reference ; constructed as level with .
In the same position or rank .
Well balanced ; even ; just ; steady ; impartial .
( phonetics ) Of even tone ; without rising or falling inflection; monotonic .
( physics ) Perpendicular to a gravitational force .
